productDescription:
XPIX Pro Series 2.2x High Definition Telephoto Lens: is great to get those far away shots when you can't get close up! Great for sports and portraiture photography too. Multi-coated, high quality glass. A protective case and front and rear caps are included. Works with 58mm front thread (filter size) lenses.

XPIX High-Definition 0.43X Wide-Angle Lens: increases your wide-angle range dramatically. Works great for scenery & indoor shooting and fits much more into your picture. Multi-Coated Optics and High-Quality construction provides great quality photos to capture memorable family photos. This Lens is compatible with High-Speed and Infra-Red shooting modes and can be used for Day or Night photography.

The Xpix Deluxe Camera Protector Bag is the perfect way to safely and neatly carry your DSLR or mirrorless camera with lenses, flash, tripod, and all other essentials. The bag has a zippered front pocket with internal compartments, an internal webbed pocket to keep your SD cards, batteries, and other small accessories safe and organized, plus three side pockets for extra storage and easy access. It is designed with a speed flap top to provide complete coverage and secures with dual quick-release buckles so you can rest assured that everything is safely protected. Additionally, there is a padded carrying handle and a removable shoulder strap making it an exceptionally comfortable and practical bag to carry with you wherever you go. Constructed with the on-the-go photographer in mind, the Xpix Deluxe Camera Protector Bag is handsome and attractive with a sleek and sturdy design.

Inside dimension : 12 1/2”(W) X 7”(D) X 7 1/2”(H) 
Outside dimension : 9 1/2”(W) X 5 1/2”(D) X 5 1/2”(H)

Xpix Manual Slave Flash 

Xpix universal manual slave flash
Ideal for Digital & SLR cameras 
Great light source for indoor & outdoor photography 
Lightweight & compact design 
Uses 2 AA batteries (not included)

XPIX Mini Tabletop/Handgrip Tripod

The XPIX Mini tripod is designed with photographers in mind, therefore, it is versatile, compact and extremely lightweight for easy portability. 


Xpix Professional USB SD/SDHC Card Reader

The Xpix memory stick is the best way to do so. Simply plug the USB stick into your computer’s USB 2.0 port and you’re ready to transfer all your files.

reviews.reviewText:
It has been 20+ years since I used an SLR (Pentax K1000), so decided it was time. This is a great kit. The reviews I read on this model confirm that it should suit my needs for a long time. The price is great. Right now the camera kit and the extra lens at Best Buy would cost you about $80 more. Camera is great. Took it out to play this afternoon. I have a Powershot G15, so I am used to the menu layouts. But I have to say the accompanying Deluxe bundle leaves a lot to be desired. I'll list Pros, OKs and Cons
Pros
You would need to buy memory cards if you bought at Best Buy. The two included cards are upgrade to the ones illustrated and currently sell on Amazon for $17 each
The filters included 2 UV filters. While it seems to be a debate if you need a UV filter on a digital camera, it does provide a bit of protection. Filter set plus extra UV filter would have cost about $25
The bag is ok. It will due until I can find better. Not enough velcro panels to really provide a lot of separate places for things.

OKs
The flash seems to be ok, but a manual flash on an automatic camera? Seriously?
SD Card wallet is a plus. I hate it when I can't find them in a bag that doesn't have little pockets.
The wrist strap I might try, but it means losing the neck strap. Have to think about that one.

Cons
The tripod is junk. Just getting it out and extending the legs said 'don't put anything on here.' With hardly any pressure, putting it on the ground with all the legs extended resulted in legs flexing and bending. Crank to elevate the center rod is stiff, and I suspect you could strip the gear teeth quite easily. Also tried to chase down specs from 'manufacturer' for load limit - none.
The telephoto/wide angle lenses are throwbacks to the days of fixed mounted lens cameras. Weren't great then, not going to be great now. Tried the telephoto, and while there is some magnification, there was also aberration.
The deluxe started cleaning kit, the tabletop tripod and the SD card reader will all find their way into oblivion.

What would have been useful instead of the detritus would have been a couple of lens pouches, for a little extra protection.

Suggestion to everyone - The supplied battery from Canon is has a capacity of 860 maH. You should consider at least one extra battery, and personally, I have had good luck with Li-Ion batteries from Wasabi. You can get 2 with a capacity of 1600 maH for $15. Opt for 2 batteries and a charger for $21. The charger comes with a 12vdc adapter to charge batteries in the car.

I just received my camera today and so far so good. Despite that I don't know how to use a camera, I was playing with it and taking pictures of my friend within the first 10 mins of getting it and I'm impressed with how good it turned out for just a testing picture and no settings changed from what it came with. Very happy and I can't wait to figure it out more! Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality! No one will know you're a beginner!
reviews.reviewText: Excellent camera for a beginner! If you want good quality photos you MUST get out of auto focus and go into manual mode. I took a few days reading some Pinterest suggestions for which lens to use with which setting, practiced with changing a few settings, and I was good to go. The lenses are good quality to get close-ups and reasonable shots of landscapes or family portraits. The handgrip tripod is great for steadying your hand and getting a less blurry shot. A lot of the other accessories don't seem to be amazing, but it's literally the same price to buy this kit as it is to buy just the camera and lenses at target, so why not? It's helpful to learn what I'm actually going to want to invest in. I didn't bother using the camera bag and just purchased a great quality camera backpack that also fits my laptop instead. Anyway it's a great value and as a beginner, I highly recommend it to anyone else looking to dip into DSLR photography. Here are some shots I took in my first week of owning it, no editing.

So I received this nifty product and let me just say that it was a phenomenal feeling. Everything on the description came in except one thing...the mini tripod. I was kind of disappointed that it didnt come in with everything included, but besides that everything else came in. Some of the stuff were inside of the bag which was a surprise because I thought I had opened everything but apparently there was more inside the deluxe bag. The camera works perfectly, everything works perfectly, but one think to know is that the external flash needs AA batteries if I am correct, but overall it's a great buy. I would recommend it for first time photographers.

One thing about it is that it's kind if hard to take pictures at night so you'll either need to be in a lighted place or keep adjusting the focus. It's a great quality camera for the price and with the extra accessories it's just a bonus. Most cameras especially canon by itself cost nearly around $400/$500 only the body and the extra accessories would be around $200 so this is a great deal. Im highly satisfied with the sellers product

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy this instead of the regular Canon 2 lens bundle
reviews.reviewText: This is the same price as the regular Canon bundles, but with WAY more stuff. You probably already know about the camera, so bundle pro/cons for me are...Pros: the body and 2 Canon lenses, SD cards, filters, card reader, table top tripod, and cleaning items. Cons: the regular size tripod is a little wobbly and the vivitar lenses (macro and wide angle) are...funky. BUT I plan to use them as props to shoot through as I hold them, so no loss there. The bag isn't a Canon, and the velcro inside is a little scratchy, and not that strong, and I thought I'd hate it, but I actually do. There are multiple pockets outside and on the top flap are very handy, and there's extra buckles that make the zippered flap even more secure. I haven't tried the flash yet, but all these extras are just bonuses. This is perfect for the beginner/student on a budget.

reviews.reviewTitle: Although I was very disappointed on the time of arrival got her about a ...
reviews.reviewText: Although I was very disappointed on the time of arrival got her about a week later than they said. The camera itself is absolutely amazing! I got everything it said it would come with. It takes professional looking photos! I love it an the price was well worth it, took these pictures with it. I went from my smartphone to this camera very easy to use!

This replaced my EOS Rebel that only had 10 megapixels and was showing its age after years of service and lots of use. All the gear from my previous Canon naturally fits this one but this set had some filters I didn't have previously which is nice. The camera and lenses are more than easily fits in the provided carrying case, not really an issue if you're only taking one or two lenses with you. Good deal overall!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a bad camera but this bundle isnt worth the cost
reviews.reviewText: This id a good beginner setup. For this package deal, id say skip it. The tripod is a flimsy piece of junk, and a bunch of the stuff that it comes with can be picked up cheap individually. I have yet to use the top mount flash, again, its not a well made product. To get started with digital slr photos, get a bag, the camera bkdy, a few good lenses, and a sturdy tripod. The rest of this was stuff i thought would be necessary, but it sure isnt. Id recommend the camera itself though. Its pretty easy to use and therea a bunch of videos on youtube that give detailed instructions on its use.

I have used many 35mm cameras as well as digital ones from 3MP to 12MP. My better cameras were a Kodak fixed-lens unit with separate light meter, a Mamiya Secor 500 with changeable lenses and built-in light meter (no microprocessor) and the 12MP digital camera.

The Canon EOS Rebel T6 blows the others out of the galaxy. This is a camera that mimics professional-grade ones available 10 to 15 years ago for three to five times the price. The "basic zone" modes (creative auto, portrait, sports, landscape, food, etc.) are of much higher quality than the compact digital ones I have used. The "creative zone" modes that give preference to shutter speed, aperture, etc.) require more technical knowledge but offer some amazing options.

I am very impressed with how fast the continuous mode works to take roughly three shots per second in portrait, sports or creative zone settings. The auto-focus takes a fraction of a second giving the ability to capture fleeting events well. I remember an acquaintance that spent thousands of dollars 15 years ago to get a camera that does not rival this one.

I really like the included (bundled) items, particularly at the price. The telephoto lens and filters are worth the up-charge alone. However, when you add the two SD cards and other items this is an incredible deal.

This purchase ranks up there with the best purchase I ever made.

I highly recommend the purchase of the Canon EOS Rebel T6/1300D for dummies book as a supplement to the camera bundle. The book has many illustrations and explains the camera operation and capabilities well.

I needed a new DSLR camera and was leaving on a trip in a week so I order this bundled after scouring the web for the best price and quality. I decided on this particular package and within the week it arrived. The 75-300MM lens is one of the best lenses I've shot with in a long time. I was immediately blown away by the quality and depth of the photos I was taken, not too surprised as Canon makes great cameras. The Bundle came with everything it said it did, more lens filters than I need to even use, but I will eventually as I slide into amateur photographer life. The macro and wide angle attachments are great when you need to get just a little bit more scenery in your shot using the 18-55mm. They easily screw onto the end of both telephoto and standard lens. The tripod is sturdy so long as you aren't dragging it over lava rock all day and the mini tripod that stands at a foot tall with legs extended is perfect for that table shot of the group or standing it up on your dresser or desk. The handheld is awesome, almost like your holding a camera gun. Great for video of moving objects and very sturdy, also folds out to be a tripod. Over all I give this bundle 5 stars across the board. I mean the price, all the accessories, you can't beat it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great bundle for someone new to DSLR
reviews.reviewText:
This is my first DSLR camera and I never owned an SLR. Most of my experience has been with older 35mm film cameras and the newer point and shoot cameras. I know many professional photographers and they all tell me it isn't the camera, its the person behind it. I believe that, but there are things you can do with a DSLR that you can't do with a point and shoot. Otherwise, wouldn't all the pros be using cheap cameras to showcase their skills?

I have been wanting to take some college classes in photography and felt this was a nice entry into DSLR's where I could manually adjust everything, learn about lenses and the purposes of them. The price was definitely better than buying everything separate. I was able to take nice pictures immediately. One portrait of my daughter in particular, I must have gotten lucky, came out really well with the blurred background and precise focusing. I am still learning to use this thing and am planning on doing some night photography with a 50 mm prime lens I also picked up. I think for the investment, especially if you plan on upgrading someday, this amount is minuscule compared to what the top cameras cost. One thing I learned after purchasing was about full and cropped frames. I wish I knew more about that beforehand since it changes the lenses and their field of view.

I read a lot of the reviews and I am with the "I love it" crowd--no complaints here. Yes, I am sure the little things in the kit for the semi-pros...I just don't care about all that. I am not a pro or even a semi-pro...I love the beauty of the images I can create both in my shots and post artistry. All of the little filters and lenses are great for me and I will enjoy playing with them and eventually outgrow them, I am sure, but I thought it was pretty cool. I gave away the tripod (table) and have a nice backpack for my camera gear--but other than that, everything is usable and great! The Vivitar lenses (wide angle, etc) are actually really nice quality and way cheaper in this format than going out and buying an expensive, full lens. I think it is a good deal--I love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Update: Was good while it worked, now won't turn on.
reviews.reviewText:
Update : After less than six months of light use, it won't turn on. Internet research has shown that this is not an uncommon problem with this camera.

Got this for a teenager who wants to get into photography. The camera is great, and all the accessories that come with it make it an even better deal. Some of the extras may not be the highest quality, but will be fine for someone just learning how to use everything. I am not the user of the camera, but I feel that it will be durable enough to last quite a while if properly taken care of.

This is a good kit for the money, I am enjoying the camera, very user friendly, and I am able to create great shots. I have only used manual mode, so I am not sure how each mode works. The lenses are good quality. 70-300 is a little slow and heavy, but for the price it is worth it. Some of the kit extras are decent, but not high quality. I would not use the tripod, as it is not strong or sturdy. Off-camera Flash is also not the best, but it works.

reviews.reviewTitle: I brought this camera bundle as new but it was ...
reviews.reviewText: I brought this camera bundle as new but it was used. Had to send to canon to get repaired. The micro lens and wide angle are not by canon. card reader was corrupted. Flash does not work. There was no case for the memory cards as shown.

This was purchased as a Christmas present. The over all quality of the product is amazing. Everything in the picture is included. Nothing was missing. Picture quality is excellent. Overall extremely happy and would recommend this to anyone.
There was a manufacturing defect in one of the lenses. When I contacted seller they were extremely friendly and willing to help in any way possible. Contacting them was very easy. They replaced the part hassle free with out any problems. I received the part in a timely manner. Very very happy with everything from start to finish.

I haven’t used the camera that much and Rebel T6 is Rebel T6. There’s so much reviews about this camera here in Amazon and YouTube.
This review is for the package for this camera. The package has so much accessories. Most are enough to get you started. As beginner, as you learned, then you will slowly upgrade like for a better tripod and additional lenses, etc.
With intermediate and higher level, they might not need the accessories that come with it but I think the package is pretty good for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: all the additional equipment is of poor quality
reviews.reviewText:
I did not like the canon camera as well, I am used to Nikon and holding the Canon camera did not feel right - the location of the buttons did not make sense to me.
I was really upset with the poor quality of all the additional equipment - it just made me feel that I bought a cheap product overall. why not to sell just the camera or add one additional product of reasonable quality?

I have a small contractor business that I take pictures during a project and after. The camera has done a great job. It did take me a little bit to figure it out but does a great job! With the pictures taken I can save them for future use, records, and advertising for customers.
I loved this camera package so much I bought another package for my father-in-law’s birthday.

This camera is absolutely amazing when it comes to point and shoot. The picture quality is amazing especially for the price. Everything thing came as pictured and was packed beautifully. It came right on time and the seller was very pleasant. It all so takes great videos. However the focus function is to great if you are trying to refocus and video just something to be aware of. I think it great for starting out. Plus over time you can up grade your lens which is a great feature.

The camera works great, takes beautiful pictures, but some of the items in the kit are not Cannon products and do not fit the camera. The wide angle lens does not fit at all, and the tripod is pretty cheesy. Would have rather have had an extra battery and double charger.

reviews.reviewTitle: LOVE THIS CAMERA & everything about it!
reviews.reviewText: Camera is great! We love Canon. I needed a second camera to film my daughter and son's games when my hubby would be at the other's game. We needed to be able to have both of us film their games so no one would miss seeing them play. I haven't had any issues as of yet, it works great. The only thing is I didn't pay close enough attention to the details of the camera before purchasing. I wanted the one w/the flip screen that opens and closes. This one doesn't do that. It has a stand-alone display screen at the back of it, but it does not move or cannot be modified in any way. Other than that, it does what it's supposed to do and takes beautiful pictures and film. We have no qualms about this camera, we LOVE it!

I did a lot of research and I am very happy with this purchase. If you are looking to enjoy photography but do not aspire to be a professional... this is the camera! Very nice quality, easy to use and wifi enabled so you can easily post to FB or other social media. I originally bought this camera for my wife and she is was so happy, I bought my daughter the exact same one.

Good introductory camera. I thought it came w/ 2 batteries like most of the other ones shown but this one does not. A little disappointed by the description is accurate so it was my bad. The direction on the Wi-Fi and NFC are horrible. It jumps you from one section to another in the booklet. Not impressed with the booklet I would give that 1 star.

I was looking for a good starter camera and I am so satisfied with this bundle!! The camera works great and I’ve already used many of the accessories that came with the bundle. The produce was shipped to me quickly and the packaging was done with care. I’m completely satisfied with the product and the service I received. Thank you!!

Terrible bait and switch.
Delivered products were not as described and pictured; replaced with cheaper items.

Returned for a refund from a reputable vendor.

I'm a beginner and I bought this package to get familiar with a camera. This is so nice and simple. My worry is that I would be overwhelmed, but it's been an opposite experience. I actually took our holiday photos with the camera and they turned out very nice.

Got everything as described and everything is working as it should. I only really started to use it (took an intro to photography class today) so I can update later. Bit of a learning curvy if you never had used such a camera before but this package overall seems to be worth the price. I can see where other reviews deem some of the non-camera/lens items as lesser, but for a started set, to see if I want to get back into it, it really does get you everything you need to start off.

I read a lot of reviews for lots of different options on Amazon and was thankful for the other reviews and their feedback. It's a stressful purchase for sure but it really does seem to be working on with me. No problems with the sellers either.

reviews.reviewTitle: A bundle with a lot of stuff you won't use, but you may want to buy it anyways
reviews.reviewText: The camera itself and the two cannon lenses are great. The trip is is flimsy but this is a starter bundle of sorts. It includes two two UV protectors which is fine but you don't need them if you're careful because all they do is protect your lens from damage. I was pleased with the quality of the small hand tripod though. I had trouble with getting the hand strap to work and it also seems like a pointless add on to me. I wish they had put in a second battery rather than an extra UV protector and a hand strap though. The bag it comes with is adequate quality. This bundle includes a lot of stuff that you probably won't ever use, I haven't even opened the flash or the filters, but it is there if you like to experiment or just want to have things available.

This comes with everything you need. If you are new to the dslr world, this is a wonderful bundle of equipment. The camera itself is a very good quality camera. I love the quality of the images. I haven't successfully tried using it for video yet. But I really love using this camera for my artwork.

Perfect, perfect and perfect! We are so happy we purchased this camera set. What you see in the picture and read you'll get, is exactly what you get when you buy this item! Everything was packed and transported with care, and came within the estimated time.
The camera makes beautiful pictures and there is a tutorial video posted on YouTube we saw to learn to operate the camera perfectly. The camera has a lot of features and it takes time to learn to use it all. I already feel like a professional photographer just by having this camera:)

AS DESCRIBE, big bang for the buck, very nice camera with lots of extras, the big zoom lens is perfect for Private Investigation work which is why I bought it, I dont know why people complain about the tri-pod, it is not a 300.00 unit but works, you get so much for your money, you may have to buy a better bag with more compartments but this is a great deal, easy to use camera.

I am completely satisfied with this camera. It came in a package that included everything one could ever need in a digital camera, lens's tri-pod, extra flash, and so much more. A very complete and satisfying package.
I will give the camera a full workout when I return to the Caribbean in July, until then I have been busy with tree and animal pictures, all of whech have been a great quality.
This set is far more than I ever expected.
Superb price, excellent seller.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... and important bits of this whole set was of good quality. Such a range of products and extra ...
reviews.reviewText: The main bulk and important bits of this whole set was of good quality. Such a range of products and extra add-ons made this purchase feel like a great bargain. However, I must say that the build quality on things like the tripod or the camera flash felt cheap when in use. This of course is just me nit-picking at the product. The camera as a whole is in perfect condition and was ready to use on arrival. Get this set if you are new to the DSLR game and want a deal which lets you try an array of various products that may or may not enhance your overall experience.

Sorry I can't write a review with how the camera works just yet I bought it as a gift for Christmas But I did open it and checked it out and I was really impressed with everything in the box so many items and lenses and filters nothing looked cheap I know my granddaughter is going to love it I can't wait till she opens it We will get back with you day after christmas

Excellent camera! Does everything I need it to do! This is an absolutely great deal as you get extra lenses, an extra flash, great filters, a tripod, 2 memory cards, camera battery, a camera bag & more. No where else can you find a Canon Rebel Camera in such a huge bundle for such a low price!

However, I did have to buy a bigger camera bag than what came with this bundle. No way can all of these great accessories fit into the camera bag included. Getting a larger camera bag was really not a big deal. I still use the camera bag that is included when I know I'll only need 2 lenses maximum & not much more.

All-in-all, this is a really good deal, & you do save money in the long run getting this excellent bundle!

Great kit for the money! I wanted an intro DSLR that I could improve as I buy nicer lenses. The tripod actually works awesome even though it's a bit wobbly, and the polorizing lens I use all the time! I haven't used all the stuff in the kit yet but they're all nice to have! The flash they give you in the kit is trash though (imo). The attached photo is before any post processing and with the stock lens!

This camera comes with accessories by Xit photo. There is the wide angle lens and the telephoto lens, the 60" tripod, the 6.5" tabletop tripod/hand grip, a side hand strap, a USB drive with a memory card reader port, a set of filter lenses plus an extra UV lens, and a starter kit with a memory card case, lens cleaning fluid, 2 cleaning cloths, 2 universal screen protectors, and 5 cotton swabs. Two other non-canon accessories are 2 sandisk 32gb memory cards and a vivitar slave flash with batteries and a hot shoe bracket.

The canon package itself comes with the two lenses, a camera bag, a strap, one battery with charger, and a USB cable.

Upon opening the only cons I have are that the extra UV filter comes in a plastic container that is the only protectant. The other three lenses come in a faux-leather camp closed case with cloth like separations on the inside for each lens. Also, the bag doesn't fit the camera body with the two lenses properly. All of it will fit if you place them in the right spot, but you risk damage and you will definitely no be able to fit all of the accessories from this bundle in it. However, if you're not a pro photographer traveling to shoots then this most likely won't be an issue.

All in all amazing camera kit for the price. If you're debating on the 5i or 6i for the flip out screen, the canon app allows you to view the camera screen live on your phone where you can touch to focus, take a photo, change settings, and many other things, which eliminates need for a flip out screen in my opinion. This alone makes it better than the 5i because it's much cheaper. Will update after a while of use!

Just received my camera two days ago but very impressed so far. New to photography and have a long way to go to figure out how to work all the different setting but have already taken some gorgeous pictures of sunsets over the lake I live on. Great starter kit for the money and found plenty of YouTube instruction videos to help me figure things out..

reviews.reviewTitle: REally great camera, and a really good deal
reviews.reviewText: I couldn't believe how much was in the package when I received it. Exactly as stated on right on time. I've only used one lens so far in my Photographing Artwork class, but it's been great. This is a different brand of camera than my old one, but I soon figured out how to set WB, Aperture, etc. Would recommend it to anyone just getting into SLR cameras for the first time.

I love this camera although I do have to take lessons on how to use it since I stepped up to a much nicer camera. Looking forward to learning all that needs to be learned about it. Great for beginners

The Rebel T6 is easy to use for beginners yet has feature to allow you to advance
to a more professional level. I would highly recommend Julie Adair King's
Canon EOS Rebel T6 for dummies

I went to school for Photography after getting out of the Army but had to discontinue and sell my camera. I became very good at Photography and have missed it. Now I can continue my Photo journey! This was a great bargain and came with a lot of accessories and is definitely worth the money. Thanks!

reviews.reviewTitle: Camera is amazing. Accessories are generic.
reviews.reviewText:
Needed to upgrade from my Rebel T3 so I went up a few steps and settle for the T6 for now.

Only thing that prevented me from giving it 5 stars was the accessories it came with. The larger tripod was decent and hasn't given me any problems. The two memory cards work VERY well and I didn't even realize it came with TWO 32gb ones. The mini tripod does not hold the camera. The flash didn't even want to slide into the camera. VERY disappointed at not getting the actual bag that was pictured. Instead got a canon bag that had one compartment with 2 dividers (shown in pictures) And the rest were just really generic and cheaply made.
I plan to just sell the accessories I will not be using and get a small profit back to go towards better quality accessories.

The actually Canon products include : The camera, the battery, the 18mm lens, the 75 mm lens, the camera bag (which did NOT look anything like the picture), and the camera strap.

The camera itself is amazing for the price. I've included some photos I took using the camera and the different lenses. It also has many shooting scenes including one for food for all us foodies.

All in all, great bundle for the price. Amazing camera as always with Canon.

reviews.reviewTitle: I’ve always wanted a dslr and I’m so happy I chose this one
reviews.reviewText: Before this camera I had a cannon PowerShot which did me well but I wanted something more. I’ve always wanted a dslr and I’m so happy I chose this one. It’s a great all around camera and easy to learn for beginners. This camera takes stunning pictures with my 50 mm lens (which I bought separately). Everything offered came nicely packaged and I’m really happy with this seller.
Loveeed this kit! As a beginner photographer this kit had everything I needed. Unfortunately I had it stolen out of my car, but the kit has everything you need and more!

reviews.reviewTitle: Camera is good. Smaller lens doesn't seem to focus well at ...
reviews.reviewText: Camera is good. Smaller lens doesn't seem to focus well at all. Tripod is too short for an adult to use. Skip the bundle, and buy just the camera and lenses, and get another tripod elsewhere.

Love my camera so much! I am A beginner so I’m still learning and Adding to it. Some of the things it came with are cheap like the tripod so you will have to buy a new one but over all worth the money!!!!

This was a gift for my daughter. A starter kit as she learns the ins and outs of becoming a photographer. I can only say that she was thrilled to receive the gift, and has had nothing but good to say about the camera, and accessories.

I bought this as a starter camera. I am use to the 35mm old school cameras but I have to say this bundle is amazing! It really gives you all you need to start anything. I absolutely love it. Looking forward to hiking this year in the PNW so worth the money I would recommend this to anyone getting into the digital age for sure
The kit changed my life. For starting a freelace photography life, it's a perfect fit. I will need to purchase a better tripod. Otherwise, I'm satisfied with my purchase and so are my fans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do yourself a favor.Buy body and lenses separately

The bonus accessories included in this bundle are fantastic. I will have to learn how to use the filters and additional lenses, but what a great value. For the same price that I would have paid for just the camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS II Lens and EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens at a major electronics retailer,I got a whole lot more.

The extra digital camera flash isn't high-end by any means, and found that mine was not working. I contacted the folks at Photo Savings to let them know the issue and they quickly sent a replacement. I found their customer service and responsiveness to be excellent.

I would recommend this package deal and buying from Photo Savings.

It's a great package: the Canon camera body, 2 Canon lenses (18-55 and 75-300 zoom), and 2 Vivitar lenses (wide angle and closeup), camera bag, a variety of filters, lightweight extendable-legs tripod and a small table-top tripod, SD cards, lens cloths, battery & recharge unit....everything you need. Bottom line: great camera and great company!

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing camera, I am very glad I bought this.
reviews.reviewText: The camera is magnificent, the quality is beautiful. Everything came in the package, undamaged and in great condition. The 18-55mm lens and the 75-300mm lens could fit in the camera bag perfectly. The battery life is good, and the camera is great for beginners. I am a beginner and the camera has been very easy for me to work with. I also read the manual and that helped a lot. I have had this camera for one week and I've not come across any problems or issues with the it, but the 57" Tripod did not come with any instructions. Although it did not come with instructions, there are many videos on YouTube for setting it up. Also, the screen protectors that came in the Starter Kit for the Cameras LCD screen and lenses, were not that great of quality, that bubbled and made streaks across the screen. There were minor issues with this bundle but overall it is a great bundle and a wonderful deal. I would recommend this bundle to a friend.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great bundle. We bought it for our son for ...
reviews.reviewText: This is a great bundle. We bought it for our son for Christmas so he could have everything he needed for a college photography class. Turns out his class is a black and white manual setting only film class, so he hasn't really dug into this kit yet. We know that this is a great camera, though, and perfect for him. It will really give him the ability to grow in this new interest without an initial outlay of huge amounts of money. I would say that the only drawback to this nice bundle, is that some of the equipment, like the tripod, is pretty flimsy. I wasn't upset by that, because it was to be expected, and I bought the bundle for the camera more than anything. Overall, this was a great 5-star purchase. It was well priced, came earlier than expected, was packaged well, and filled with lots of goodies. I would definitely purchase again.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this Rebel T6 Bundle
reviews.reviewText:
Purchased this to take the orchid jewelry product photos for Johanns Orchid Treasures my wife creates from the orchids from her backyard nursery.
This camera was recommended to me by a wedding photographer friend because
• It would take quality photos
• It has an easy learning curve for us. She was RIGHT.
The Canon EOS Rebel T6 DSLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS II Lens, EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Lens, and Deluxe Accessory Bundle has all of the lenses needed for close ups of the products.
After the items in the box another big plus is that Canon Rebel T6 has an app that lets you use your smart phone as a view finder and shutter control.
I use the BlueDot Trading-Photo Tabletop Studio Light 24-Inch/60cm Tent Box Kit with 2 Lamps and Camera Stand - Large Photobox (White) for all of the photos.
For the tasks I need to complete both of these products are definitely 5 stars.

Orchid photo taken in the BlueDot light box using the Rebel T6 18-55mm lens with the HD wide angle macro converter lens in the kit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Pictures. Light Weight. Reasonably Priced.
reviews.reviewText: We wanted a camera that took good pictures and was not that difficult to use. The camera is light weight, takes great pictures and reasonably priced. If you expect a professional camera, this is probably not what your looking for. If you want an everyday usable camera this camera fits the bill. It has several preset functions and has advanced functions that if wanted we could easily use to customize our photos. Regarding the "bundle" it contains 'Canon Lens' not generic brand lens. The bundle also contains other peripheral items that are all the accessories you could ever want. There is a learning curve, but you could take quality pictures right out of the box....after charging the battery. It is a good everyday camera made by reputable company 'Canon'. We received the package from the seller timely and it was well packed. The seller took the time to contact us to make sure we were satisfied with our purchase which was appreciated.
All items shown arrived in package as advertised

My mini tripod broke on first attempt to open it, and the full size is so flimsy it is going straight in the trash without ever being used. I value the Camera, and lenses, so I will not use the main tripod at all, its guaranteed to fall over and break the camera.

The bag is sufficient, temporally. Some of the Velcro dividers are coming undone, after one attempt to organize the bag better.

I still think with the low quality accessories, that this is a good deal. I am extremely picky about certain things, and I think others may find them adequate.

qAndA.question: Is there a big difference between the T6 and the T5 ?
qAndA.answer:
The T6 gives you Wi-Fi connectivity with NFC (allows users to tap a NFC enabled device to activate Wi-Fi). Other upgrades include:
